TopicTitle: How to stop engines from shutting down during overheating?

Articles.Content: All air-breathing engines overheat soon after reaching supersonic speeds and automatically shut down, even though I have "Ignore Max Temperature" enabled. All of my planes are unflyable due to this...

You need to provide more info (screenshot of plane, mods installed, etc.). It doesn't sound stock behavior. The closest mod behavior I know is from KSP interstellar, where you'll have to add a precooler after your intake to not overheat the engine. But that limit is way beyond supersonic - e.g. rapier is ~1350m/s. Without interstellar, or with interstellar but precooler properly mounted, should be totally ok to reach 1.4~1.5km/s.
Sounds about right, I have Interstellar Extended and that happens usually with rapiers. Its really a pain with SSTOs, but this time I'm only going 900 m/s and my ram jet starts to overheat.
